content: to make body in colours that complement yarn i used a small amount of yellow for the body front and the rest was dark green for smaller frog for the larger frog i used navy blue all fabric was scraps an old t-shirt would supply sufficient fabric  hand sewing needle and thread for body construction if you have a sewing machine you could machine stitch the body panels instead of hand sewing  8 chenille sticks 30cm long for smaller frog and floristry/garden wire for the larger frog if this toy is for a small child omit wires i good swap might be a length of stiff macrame cord or plaited stretch fabric  fabric scissors  darning needle  tape measure  pins  pliers  quilters clips optional but handy abbreviations us terms chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch tile = one square of completed c2c ch3 3dc method of c2c used i used the ch3 3dc sizing method for the c2c tiles other techniques required  mattress stitch  ladder stitch  running stitch  embroidery backstitch  embroidery blanket stitch instructions are written for smaller frog with a list of instruction swaps at the end for the larger frog instructions frog body using main frog colour and 4mm hook create 2 panels of c2c each being 8 tiles wide and 13 tiles long fasten_off each panel leaving a long tail to be used for mattress stitching panels together legs using main frog colour and 4mm hook create 2 panels of c2c each being 4 tiles wide and 23 tiles long fasten_off each panel leaving a long tail to be used for mattress stitching arms for the bottoms of the arms using main frog colour and 4mm hook create 2 panels of c2c each being 4 tiles wide and 9 tiles long fasten_off each panel leaving a long tail to be used for mattress stitching in addition make 2 shoulder sections as follows crochet 3 row of tiles at the end of the final tile turn ch3 half_double_crochet into the second stitch and single_crochet into 3rd stitch *slip_stitch into next space created by ch3 and work ch1 single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet * repeat * * into next 2 spaces created by the ch3 fasten_off leaving long tail to join to each of the arm bottoms align 1 arm bottom to one should section and mattress stitch panels together repeat for other arm flippers using main frog colour and 4mm hook create 8 flipper panels of c2c each being 3 tiles wide and 3 tiles long as follows crochet 3 row of tiles at the end of the final tile ch1 turn and slip_stitch into all 3 stitches and into slip_stitch into the space created by ch3 in this space ch1 single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch into next space and ch1 single_crochet half_double_crochet
